alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:49PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Platte County through 315 PM MDT... At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Slater, or 15 miles southeast of Wheatland, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slater and Bordeaux. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 57 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
